intro: Phyllanthus bienhoensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often waxy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The leaves and roots of Phyllanthus bienhoensis have been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
